visualization_prompt: Generate a column chart showing comparative agricultural production quantities between corn and wheat across major producing countries using pattern-filled bars with value annotations and interactive y-axis zoom.

title.text: Corn vs Wheat Estimated Production for 2020 (1000 MT)

visualization_explanation: The dataset contains two quantitative variables (corn/wheat production) across six categorical entities (countries), forming a 2×6 multivariate comparison. Data originates from indexmundi, a reputable agricultural statistics source, with values reflecting real 2020 production estimates. The column chart maximizes data-ink ratio per Tufte's principles by eliminating gridlines and using minimal axis styling while maintaining Cairo's perceptual accuracy through proportional bar lengths and pattern differentiation for colorblind accessibility. Value annotations directly on bars reduce cognitive load compared to cross-referencing axis ticks. Production values span four orders of magnitude (14.5K to 406K 1000 MT), requiring careful y-axis labeling to maintain readability of small-value columns without truncation.
